title: How Did i get a priority queue?
body: ok so I just played a normal game as Master Yi and my internet suddenly cut off so I came back 5 mins later in the game with mobile data and continued playing. I didn't feed and I did all right and we came back and won and after we won and got into lobby a notification saying I got priority queue popped up. um HOW?!?!? I clearly came back, wasted my mobile data and some money just so I don't get priority queue and we even won! WHY RITO? HOW AND WHY DID I GET A PRIORITY QUEUE?!?!?!? I CAME BACK AND WON THE GAME. PLS EXPLAIN.

replies.body: so are you saying if i'm going to leave the game more than 5 minutes, I might as well stay afk for the whole game?

Leaving for the whole game will only make you more likely to receive longer LPQs more easily in the future. The more and longer you afk/dc, the more severe the punishments.

Where it will take an average player quite a few short leaves to get an LPQ, someone who has a long history of afks/dcs will get an LPQ almost instantly after offending.

It's also worth noting that afks/dcs in ranked are treated much more harshly than those in other game modes.

The Leavebuster system will identify you as an AFker/DCer *regardless* of whether or not you return to the game, in situations where you are DCed/AFK for 5+ minutes. As a note, Leavebuster will not give punishments for a first offence in minor cases, and it will not give longer punishments (10/20 minutes or, potentially, bans) in anything but extreme cases.

The thing you need to consider is that leaving a game (whether intentional or not) for most-any duration will have a significant impact and, in most cases, will be enough to ruin it for several of the other players, even if it's only a minute or two.
